page.title: 17AUCHINLECK 1939-45 ARMY
page.content: Pennylands Camp,which lies to the south of Auchinleck was built around 1940 by the Royal Engineers as a training camp for the Tank Corps.During that time the Barony Road was lined with many tanks because of the excellent cover given by its avenue of mature trees. The Officers used Auchinleck House as their Headquarters. During wartime the camp was also used for other purposes. It was used as a transit camp for many regiments;Grenadier Guards, Inniskillens and some Canadian Regiments.Later the camp was used as a Prisoner of War Camp for German and Italian P.O.W's.At the end of the war it was used as a repatriation camp for Polish soldiers before they returned to their own country. There is now little remaining of the camp.
